summary: Joystick and Shoot button UIs appear to be converted from image-based to code-rendered neon/glow designs with touch/mouse handling preserved. Player ship rendering in the canvas appears replaced with Canvas 2D vector drawing (no image usage visible). However, the diff also introduces additional, non-requested rendering/viewport behavior changes (e.g., visualViewport resizing and a visible canvas border) and broad styling/theme utility additions that were not explicitly requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Changed canvas sizing logic to use window.visualViewport (and added listeners) beyond just replacing the player ship image rendering.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-28 only asks to replace the ship image with code-rendered drawing while preserving rotation and performance; viewport sizing changes are not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Added drawing of a visible neon border rectangle around the entire canvas.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-28/29; request scope was limited to joystick, shoot button, and player ship visuals, and explicitly said not to redesign other visuals/layout.

hallucinated_features.description: Modified bullet rendering to include size-based color variations (small/medium/large) with glow settings shown in the render loop.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; non-goals include not changing bullets. Even if only visual, it extends beyond the requested three elements (joystick/shoot/ship).

hallucinated_features.description: Added/expanded global CSS utilities for gameplay overlay positioning, dynamic viewport height variable, and multiple neon shadow utilities.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not explicitly requested; scope was limited to replacing joystick/shoot/ship visuals. These changes may support the new visuals but are additional features beyond the explicit requirements.

hallucinated_features.description: Extended Tailwind theme with a neon color palette, custom shadows, and animations.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not explicitly requested in the BuildRequest; it goes beyond directly replacing the specific image-based elements.
